Aero Services International Inc said it expects to achieve improvements in overall operations in the year ending September 30, 1987. Earlier, Aero reported a 1986 year end net loss of 3.0 mln dlrs compared to a profit of 483,000 dlrs in 1985. The company said the loss was attributable to costs associated with its acquisition costs and operating losses of nine Beckett Aviation fixed base operations purchased in August 1985 and discontinued weather service and flight simulator segments.
Reuter
